column4: What can I use to do audio transcoding?  I need to convert wma to ogg, but I don't mind going via wav.  And ffmpeg is no good, it won't read the files.
wma is not easy to convert
so I'm finding out :)
ffmpeg will do it, or mplayer, unless it is encoded
my amarok plays them OK.  Not sure if I can use whatever backend it uses for transcoding?
can you play it in mplayer
ffmpeg will not accept the files
someone raised a bug for me on it in fact
yeah mplayer plays it.  Can I use that somehow?
mplayer -dumpaudio i think it is

Dumps raw compressed audio stream to ./stream.dump (useful with MPEG/AC-3, in most other cases the resulting file will not be playable). If you give more than one of −dumpaudio, −dumpvideo, −dumpstream on the command line only the last one will work.
yeah I just read that, but it does say that the result will not be playable
mencoder -oac
ahhh cool thanks!!
mencoder won't seem to do it without a video stream, so I'm tring Perl Audio Converter :)
mencoder -ovc dummy should workj
Option ovc: Unknown suboption dummy
i don't have any wma files to try, is your public somewhere
yeah its at http://www.carlyleclarke.plus.com/01%20Feeling%20Oblivion.wma
thanks
mplayer -ao pcm:file=test.wav 01\ Feeling\ Oblivion.wma
works fine
thanks for that mplayer fix earlier, it worked perfectly... someone arrived at that moment so didn't have a chance to say thanks
